remarks: Any small collection of small subsets of ` A ` cannot have union ` A ` , where "small" means smaller than the cofinality.  This is a stronger version of ~ cfslb .  This is a common application of cofinality: under AC, ` ( aleph `` 1 ) ` is regular, so it is not a countable union of countable sets.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2013.)
statement:
cfslb.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
cfslb2n $p |- ( ( Lim A /\ A. x e. B ( x C_ A /\ x ~< ( cf ` A ) ) ) -> ( B ~< ( cf ` A ) -> U. B =/= A ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
